articles.author: Dominique Vidalon, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Vandals targeted France's high-speed train network with a series of coordinated actions that brought major disruption to some of the country's busiest rail lines ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony on Friday.
articles.title: Arsonists attack French railways hours before Olympic ceremony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi lashed towns on China's coastal Fujian province on Friday with heavy rains and strong winds as the most powerful storm to hit the country this year began its widely watched trek into the populous interior.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi lashes southeast China after pounding Taiwan, flooding Philippines

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will sit down, separately, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday, for high stakes talks on winding down the Gaza conflict.
articles.title: Biden, Harris to meet Netanyahu separately on Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Former President Barack Obama and his wife Michelle endorsed Kamala Harris' bid for president on Friday in a roughly one-minute long video that captured a private phone call between the couple and the current vice president.
articles.title: Barack and Michelle Obama endorse Harris in video of live call

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukrainian energy facilities in two regions between the capital Kyiv and the Russian border with drones overnight, leaving tens of thousands of people without power, Ukraine's national power grid operator said on Friday.
articles.title: Russian drones knock out Ukrainian power facilities near Kyiv

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mayela Armas, Julia Cobb
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado and her coalition's candidate Edmundo Gonzalez have commanded enthusiastic crowds during their campaign to unseat President Nicolas Maduro and end 25 years of ruling party dominance.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition seeks to end 25 years of socialist power in Sunday vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The World Health Organization is sending more than one million polio vaccines to Gaza to be administered over the coming weeks to prevent children being infected after the virus was detected in sewage samples, its chief said on Friday.
articles.title: WHO sends over 1 mln polio vaccines to Gaza to protect children

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union will transfer 1.5 billion euros in proceeds from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on social media platform X on Friday.
articles.title: EU transfers 1.5 billion euros from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine

articles.author: Drazen Jorgic
articles.description: Mexican drug lord Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada and the son of his former partner, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, were arrested in El Paso, Texas, on Thursday, the U.S. Justice Department said.
articles.title: US arrests Mexican drug lord 'El Mayo' and El Chapo's son in Texas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said on Friday that Dmitry Bulgakov, a former deputy defence minister, had been arrested and charged with corruption, the Interfax news agency reported.
articles.title: Russian ex-defence minister arrested for corruption, says Interfax
